comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: The Pump Room was built in 1884 as a place where people could come to take the unique thermal mineral water. It ceased use as a Pump Room 1981 and became a Micrarium where microscopic organisms and geological specimens could be studied by the public. This was the world's first Micrarium but sadly closed in 1995. It is to be turned into tearooms in 2014. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buxton www.derbyshireguide.co.uk/travel/buxton.htm www.lonelyplanet.com/england/the-midlands/buxton/things-t...
